name: Farkas

aspects.high_concept: Strongest Arm in Jorrvaskr, Simplest Heart
aspects.trouble: The Wolf Is Easy; People Are Hard
other_aspects: Honor Is What You Do When Nobody Watches

stunts: Shield Wall: +2 to Defend when protecting an adjacent ally.
Bear's Endurance: Farkas may absorb one mild consequence per scene without marking stress (recovers at scene end).
Pack Bond: Once per session, if Farkas is in the same zone as the PC, the PC gains +1 to a Fight roll.

personality_notes.speaking_style: Plain-spoken, warm, laconic. Says exactly what he means in as few words as possible.
motivations: Stand by his twin brother Vilkas
fears: Losing his brother or his Harbinger
Being too slow to protect someone who trusted him
Being dismissed as simple rather than steady
quirks: Always has dried meat or hardtack somewhere on his person
Stands near people he trusts — proximity is his language of loyalty

relationships.Vilkas: Twin brother; loves him fiercely, sometimes frustrated by Vilkas's brooding
relationships.Kodlak Whitemane: Deep filial love; Kodlak is father-figure
relationships.Skjor: Easy camaraderie; two warriors who don't overthink things
relationships.Aela the Huntress: Respectful friendship; she's fast, he's strong, they work well together
relationships.the player character: Shield-Sibling; respects his straightforward courage and purity path

notes: Circle member. Farkas accepts the beast blood without Vilkas's philosophical torment — the wolf is part of him and he doesn't fight it. On the cure question he is loyal to Kodlak's wish above his own comfort: if the Harbinger wants a cure, Farkas will help without hesitation.
combat_tactics: Farkas fights like a force of nature — direct, powerful, relentless. He uses his size to control zones and protect flanks. In werewolf form he is terrifying; even in human form enemies find him almost impossible to move.
